meanings.sent1: The detective decided to reinvestigate the crime scene for more clues.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reinvestigate old cases to ensure justice is served.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat wanted to reinvestigate the mysterious noise in the attic.
meanings.sent4: She had to reinvestigate her assumptions after new evidence came to light.
meanings.sent5: The scientist will reinvestigate the experiment to confirm the results.

meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to reinvestigate their research topics for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often reinvestigate their findings to validate their conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reinvestigate the recipe after realizing a key ingredient was missing.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reinvestigate her study habits to improve her grades.
meanings.sent5: The historian will reinvestigate the ancient artifacts to uncover new insights.
